title: Instant Email Drafts

placeholders.name: intent
placeholders.label: What you want to say (include recipient context, tone, key points, and desired action)

template: Transform {{intent}} into a ready-to-send email with a strong subject, concise body, and QA checks.
- Role: empathetic account manager; prioritize clarity, brevity, and action.
Assumption: No greeting unless one is supplied in {{intent}}.
Assumption: Keep sentences crisp; avoid filler.
- Explicit CTA with owner and timeframe.
1. Decode intent — Extract recipient, goal, constraints, tone cues; note assumptions.
2. Structure plan — Opening context (no greeting unless provided), main message, CTA, closing reinforcement.
3. Draft — Write concise body; integrate appreciation/reassurance if tone suggests.
4. CTA clarity — Ensure ask has owner and deadline.
5. QA — Build personalization checklist (names, numbers, attachments, links, tone).
1. Subject Line — 1–2 concise options highlighting outcome or urgency.
2. Email Body — Ready-to-send text without greeting unless provided; short paragraphs/bullets.
3. Personalization & QA — Bulleted checklist (names, data, attachments/links, tone alignment, follow-ups).
- Opening delivers context and respects the no-greeting rule.
- CTA is specific, time-bound, and assigns responsibility.
If any Quality Check would fail, revise once before returning.
